question.text: Some people prefer living in a city, while others prefer living in the countryside. Discuss both views and give your opinion.

sections.title: Question Analysis

questionType.explanation: You must discuss BOTH perspectives (city vs countryside) equally and clearly state your own opinion.

taskRequirements: Provide specific examples for each view

Opinion is unclear or too balanced

editor.placeholder:
Start writing your essay here. Refer to your plan in Section 4.

Remember:
• 4 paragraphs (Introduction, Body 1, Body 2, Conclusion)
• 250-280 words
• Use formal academic style
• Include examples

guidancePanel.title: Writing Tips
tips: Follow your plan from Section 4 - don't change structure midway
Use topic sentences to start each body paragraph
Include linking words (However, Furthermore, For instance)
Avoid contractions (don't → do not, can't → cannot)
Leave 5 minutes at the end to check for errors

sections.title: Check Your Essay
sections.description: Use this checklist to review your work

items.label: Introduction clearly paraphrases the question (not copied)
tips: Use synonyms: city → urban areas, countryside → rural regions, prefer → favor

items.label: Body paragraph 1 has clear topic sentence about city living
tips: Topic sentence = first sentence stating main advantage

items.label: Body paragraph 2 discusses countryside living
tips: Use transition: However, On the other hand, Conversely

items.label: Conclusion summarizes both views + states opinion clearly
tips: Your opinion must be clear - which do you support or does it depend on factors?

items.label: Both views are discussed with equal detail
tips: Count sentences - each view should have similar length

items.label: Personal opinion is clearly stated
tips: Use: In my view, I believe that, From my perspective

items.label: Specific examples are provided for each view
tips: Real examples like specific cities or studies are strongest

items.label: All parts of the question are fully addressed
No repeated words - synonyms used throughout
Topic vocabulary from Section 2 is used correctly
Complex sentences are used (not all simple sentences)
tips: Use: who, which, that, although, while, because

items.label: Verb tenses are consistent and correct

sections.title: Band 8 Model Answer
sections.description: Compare your essay with this high-band example

essay.fullEssay:
The choice between urban and rural living environments has long been a subject of debate, with advocates on both sides citing distinct advantages. While both lifestyles have merit, I believe the ideal choice depends fundamentally on individual priorities and life circumstances.

On the one hand, city living offers substantial benefits in terms of career advancement and cultural enrichment. Urban centers concentrate diverse industries and employment opportunities, providing professionals with access to competitive salaries, networking possibilities, and career progression that rural areas simply cannot match. For instance, metropolitan regions like London or Singapore host international corporations, creative industries, and specialized sectors that drive economic growth and innovation. Furthermore, cities provide rich cultural experiences through museums, theaters, restaurants, and entertainment venues that enhance quality of life. The superior infrastructure and public services, including efficient transportation networks and world-class healthcare facilities, make daily life more convenient and accessible.

On the other hand, countryside living delivers significant health and wellbeing advantages that urban environments lack. Rural areas offer cleaner air, reduced noise pollution, and abundant natural spaces that promote both physical and mental health. Research consistently demonstrates that rural residents experience lower rates of respiratory illnesses, cardiovascular problems, and stress-related conditions compared to urban populations. Additionally, countryside communities typically foster stronger social bonds and provide safer environments for raising families, with lower crime rates and more cohesive neighborhoods. The slower pace of life and connection to nature appeal strongly to those prioritizing tranquility over convenience.

In conclusion, while cities excel in providing career opportunities and cultural amenities, countryside living offers superior environmental quality and health benefits. The optimal choice ultimately depends on whether one values professional development and convenience more than environmental tranquility and wellbeing.

strengths: Clear position with nuanced understanding (depends on priorities)
Both views discussed equally with specific examples
Strong topic sentences in each paragraph
Wide range of vocabulary (enrichment, cohesive, tranquility)
Complex sentence structures with varied grammar

annotations.explanation: Transforms 'city vs countryside' into sophisticated language using 'urban and rural living environments'.

annotations.highlight: On the one hand... On the other hand...
annotations.explanation: Clear parallel transitions demonstrate systematic discussion of both perspectives.

annotations.highlight: For instance, metropolitan regions like London or Singapore...
annotations.explanation: Concrete, real-world examples with specific cities strengthen task response and demonstrate knowledge.
Different linking words maintain coherence and demonstrate linguistic flexibility.
Academic vocabulary used naturally demonstrates strong lexical resource appropriate for Band 8.

annotations.highlight: employment opportunities, providing professionals with access to competitive salaries, networking possibilities, and career progression that rural areas simply cannot match
annotations.explanation: Sophisticated structure combining participial phrase, list, and relative clause shows advanced grammatical control.
